explanation: The 1970 African Cup of Champions Clubs Final stands as one of Asante Kotoko’s most significant matches in history—marking the club’s first major continental triumph and showcasing its golden era. This lineup, played in a disciplined 4-3-3 formation under coach C.K. Acquah, featured a starting XI that combined a rock‐solid defense (anchored by Nana Kwame Mensah, William Amankwaa, Osei Kofi, Albert Djamson, and Frank Sarfo) with a midfield that balanced defensive grit and creative flair (Kwame Nti, Robert Wiafe, and Amadu Bediako). The attacking trio of Emmanuel Ofori, Samuel Agyeman, and Charles Appiah provided the cutting edge that sealed the win. All 15 players (the 11 starters plus 4 key substitutes) took part in this historic match, ensuring that their collective excellence and peak performance are forever etched in the annals of the club’s storied legacy.
